alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Ritchie; Wirt (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 11 at 1:03AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central West Virginia and northern West Virginia, including the following counties, in central West Virginia, Calhoun. In northern West Virginia, Ritchie and Wirt. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 100 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms earlier in the evening. Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Creeks and streams rose out of their banks and a few homes and several roads were flooded, mostly in Smithville. Most flood waters were quickly receding. However, watch for high water or road closure signs. It is especially difficult at night to determine the depth of the water. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Smithville, Brohard, Macfarlan and Burnt House. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
